[UPDATED on April 14, 2021]

Course format:
This online course is conducted mainly through synchronous (“live / interactive”) learning methods:
- Course meetings will be ‘live’ online using Zoom at the regularly scheduled course time (Tuesday, 3rd period) -- student
participation is expected.
- The first course meeting is Tuesday, April 20th at 1:30pm. The Zoom link will be emailed to registered students and available
on Luna.
- Course meetings will consist of mini lectures, discussions, peer and instructor feedback sessions, group work, and student
presentations.
- Students should have a device to participate in Zoom meetings and a Gmail account to access the course Google Drive folder (to
be shared in the first meeting). Students will also be using Microsoft Word and Powerpoint (or the Google equivalents) and
Turnitin.com.
- The materials and assignments will be provided in the course Google Drive folder as the course progresses. Students are
expected to check it regularly.
- Students will submit assignments through the course Google Drive folder and Turnitin.com.

NOTE 1: This course is intended to improve students’ academic English skills. Therefore, all materials, instruction,
communications, and assignments are in English. Students are expected to only use English.

NOTE 2: This class is very demanding, involving a lot of reading and writing assignments. Additionally, thorough preparation and
active class participation are expected.

NOTE 3: The course time lost due to the first cancelled lesson (April 13) has been accounted for in the study time required in
the remaining 13 lessons. No additional make-up lessons will be necessary.

トピック.授業計画1: Some class time will involve the use of reading assignments and preparation tasks for discussion, formulating responses to articles, and planning for written responses, which will be submitted as course writing assignments. Some class time will involve peer and instructor feedback sessions on writing assignments and revision planning.
